page.topic: How to Plot Multiple Data Series on a Single Chart
page.description: Multiple data series can be plotted in one Chart control, either as one chart type or using several chart types.

discussion.p: The Chart control can be configured to plot multiple data series as separate charts in the Chart control. The individual charts can be rendered as the same type (such as a bar or line chart) or as a combination of chart types - e.g. a bar chart with a trendline.

You can plot as many series as you want in the Chart control. Each series to plot is added using the *[ui:Data]* property. The style of each Data series can be modified using the *[ui:Chart Style]* builder. In the *[ui:Chart Style]* builder, you can define the *[ui:Chart Type]* and appearance of each data series independently of other series in the Chart control. For example, in a vertical bar chart that displays monthly temperatures, you can plot the "Record High" data series as a Line chart follows:

section.title: Plotting Series Using Different Chart Types

step.description: Open the *[ui:Chart Style]* builder by clicking the [...] button for the *[ui:Chart style]* property.
On the *[ui:Series Styles]* tab, select the desired *[ui:Chart Type]* for the data series.
